text: this is my first solo single I'm very
excited about it and it's a Bonnie Raitt
song called like I'll make you love me
which is a ballad and I've turned it
into a EDM track so it's it's a
beautiful song it's the reason I wanted
to become a musician and I wanted to
share that with the world what were the
challenges facing you when you started
your singing career well they're
different - when you first started
acting when I started acting I guess I
didn't know anything I was like okay how
do you do this so it was I had to learn
everything on the job and the same way I
think with music it's been learning on
the job bill music has been something
I've been familiar with in tons of food
he played a lot of roles seductress
serial killer even an animated plane and
what's been the most challenging so far
I think the challenges lies more in
trying to do something different every
single time then doing what I'm doing
I'm an actor and I like to play
different paths I like to be different
people and my job allows me to do that
and more than that I think it's really
fascinating for me there - now you know
being a musician actor you know for me
this whole thing is very new and
extremely fascinating and very very
challenging coming up here doing a
biopic film about Mary calm more than it
being a biopic on Mary comm it's a story
of every girl who decides that I don't
want to be limited I don't want to be
put into a box I want to be more than
what I'm supposed to be you know as
women we're we're always told that this
is this is what you should be this is
what you should do and here's a girl who
you know is born to rice paddy farmers
in
in you know in a far-off northeast of
India and and she becomes a five-time
world boxing champion and an has two
children and it's still she's just 33
years old so she's a huge achiever
someone who we take as a pride and joy
and it's a it's a big challenge to be
playing that part especially getting
punched in the face that's hardcore
before that we've got gun day of course
coming up soon I love the music of them
day and I think the film is going to be
something that people will love you
started your career in a beauty pageant
how do you view beauty pageants now it
taught me so much for me it was the
turning point in my life it I grew up
really soon and it was an amazing
experience and I think that you know
being a part of something competitive
for me the beauty pageants was a lot
more than just being about the about
being beautiful it was you know having
personality being intelligent and and
being told that in front of the whole
world it was amazing for me you've been
quite vocal about issues affecting women
and girls there's been a lot of talk
here in England this week we saw some
statistics suggesting the girls were
being aborted in the UK especially
amongst the South Asian community how do
you raise awareness about a sensitive
subject like that it is very sensitive
but as sensitive as it is it's very real
it's something that exists in in the
world that we live in I take it very
seriously for me the education of the
girl child and the upbringing of a girl
child is very very important there are
so many parents which come up to me and
tell me you know I'd rather feed my
children than send one of them to school
because we can't afford it you know
primary education is mandatory in India
now and more than anything it's a
mindset kind of thing and especially you
know I've read statistics in in England
to a child as a child as a child whether
it's a girl or a boy it's it's the
ammunition that you give them is what
will make them you know be able to live
their lives standing on their own feet
whether it's a boy or a girl and you can
always rely on your children depending
on how much you give to them and I think
this is an awareness that people that
need to find the kindness in their heart
to know that you know it's a child
that's all it is it's a child and it
deserves to live
